page.title: 10HEALTH
page.content:
{Slough Water Pollution Control Works. This covers 32 hectares and Manor Farm which is attached is 57\ hectares. Site acquired in 1938. Sewage comes from toilets,baths & sinks & surface drainage in vicinity of{Slough,Chalvey,Windsor & Eton Wick. Approximately 17,000,000 cubic metres of sewage is treated annualy. There are 40 people employed at works.
The sewage enters a large tank where sludge and water are separated. The sludge is sold to farmers for fertilizer. The water enters clinker beds for cleaning. Then bacteria and worms are used in cleaning process.Chemicals remove ammonia from water before it enters the River Thames. Many complaints are recieved from the public about the smell.
